actions.name: List versions
actions.description:
Lists information about all
 Orchestration API versions.

tenant_id.description:
The unique identifier of the tenant or
 account.

actions.name: Create stack
actions.description: Creates a stack.

actions.name: Adopt stack
actions.description:
Creates a stack from existing
 resources.

actions.name: List stack data
actions.description: Lists active stacks.

 account.

actions.name: Preview stack
actions.description: Previews a stack.

tenant_id.description:
The unique identifier of the tenant or
 account.

actions.name: Find stack
actions.description:
Finds the canonical URL for a
 specified stack.
 Also works with verbs other than GET, so you can
 perform PUT and DELETE operations on a current
 stack. Set your client to follow redirects. Note that
 when redirecting, the request method should not
 change, as defined in RFC2626. However, in many
 clients the default behavior is to change the method
 to GET when you receive a 302 because this behavior
 is ubiquitous in web browsers.

tenant_id.description:
The unique identifier of the tenant or

actions.description:

actions.name: Abandon stack
actions.description:
Deletes a specified stack but
 leaves its resources intact, and returns data
 describing the stack and its resources.

actions.name: Abandon stack preview
actions.description:
Gets a preview of abandon data,
 describing the current state of the stack and its
 resources.

 metadata for a specified server.
 Use the group property to specify the
 configuration hook to which the pass the metadata
 item.
